skill.name: Chapter Analyzer
skill.description: Validates and analyzes Docusaurus MDX chapters for structure, pedagogical quality, and component usage.
skill.summary: Validates and analyzes Docusaurus MDX chapters for structure, pedagogical quality, and component usa...
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code, no network access, no filesystem access beyond its own directory, and no external command execution. Contains only markdown content defining chapter validation rules.

content.value_statement: Docusaurus chapter quality varies widely, making it hard to maintain consistent educational content. This skill validates MDX chapters for structural integrity, pedagogical flow, and proper component usage to ensure every chapter meets high educational standards.
actual_capabilities: Validates YAML frontmatter structure and required fields in MDX chapters
Checks heading hierarchy compliance (H1 for title, H2+ for content)
Verifies pedagogical flow with introduction, objectives, core content, interactive elements, and summary
Audits usage of custom components like Quiz and Simulation
Validates multi-language code blocks using Tabs and TabItem components
Evaluates tone and voice for encouraging, accessible educational writing
limitations: Does not execute or test code examples within chapters
Does not modify or write back to chapter files
Does not validate external links or image references
Does not perform spell checking or grammar analysis

use_cases.title: Maintain Documentation Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all submitted chapters follow consistent structure and quality guidelines before publishing.

use_cases.title: Validate Learning Content
use_cases.description: Verify that educational chapters include proper learning objectives and interactive elements.

use_cases.title: Enforce MDX Best Practices
use_cases.description: Automate chapter validation in CI pipelines to maintain documentation quality at scale.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Chapter Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use chapter-analyzer to validate textbook/docs/getting-started.mdx for proper YAML frontmatter and heading structure.

prompt_templates.title: Component Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run chapter-analyzer to verify that textbook/docs/ros2-basics.mdx includes required Quiz or Simulation components.

prompt_templates.title: Pedagogical Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply chapter-analyzer to analyze the pedagogical quality of textbook/docs/advanced-topics.mdx including objectives and summary sections.

prompt_templates.title: Full Documentation Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute chapter-analyzer on all MDX files in textbook/docs/ and generate a report of any structural or quality issues found.

best_practices: Always run chapter-analyzer before committing new or modified documentation to catch issues early.
Use consistent sidebar_label across all chapters to improve navigation clarity.
Include at least one interactive element (Quiz or Simulation) per major section to boost engagement.
anti_patterns: Using H1 headings within chapter body (should only use H2 and deeper levels).
Skipping the Learning Objectives section (violates pedagogical requirements).
Leaving YAML frontmatter incomplete or using non-descriptive descriptions.

faq.question: Which file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports .mdx and .md files in Docusaurus documentation directories.

faq.question: What are the required frontmatter fields?
faq.answer: Required: id, title, sidebar_label, description. All must be present and non-empty.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, run against any chapter file to get structured validation output suitable for CI checks.

faq.question: Is user data stored or transmitted anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill operates locally and does not transmit any chapter content externally.

faq.question: Why are my headings being flagged as incorrect?
faq.answer: Docusaurus uses the frontmatter title as H1. Chapter body must start with H2 (##) and never use H1.

faq.question: How does this compare to other documentation linters?
faq.answer: Chapter-analyzer specifically targets Docusaurus MDX conventions and educational content quality, unlike generic markdown linters.
